attributes.title: Stock Verification
attributes.description:
1.      Physical Stock Take

Findings;

·       A stock take was conducted on 1 March 2025 to establish whether the physical stocks were matching with the stock book balance generated from SAP system and whether internal controls on stocks were effective.

·       The physical stock count revealed minimal variances when compared with the system's recorded balance for almost all stock items. However, notable discrepancies were observed in the following categories:

ü  Packing Materials: Variance of +37 pieces.

ü  Bread Stock: White Bread: Variance of (24) pieces

ü  Vegetable Oil: -1.25 Kgs 1.e 10 Units ~ 10 Bags

ü  Yeast : -0.51Kgs i.e. 4.08 bags

The table below illustrates the findings:
attributes.recommendation:
·       Utto and Yeast Consumption is slightly higher and regular stock checks should be done to ensure that inventory accuracy is maintained and future discrepancies are avoided.

·       Strong controls on Yeast should be adhered to in order to minimize the variance.
attributes.effect: The discrepancies in Utto and Yeast are a concern, indicating weak controls.
attributes.remediation_plan: Verify polybags stock upon receipt by weighing to make sure the Kgs indicated tally with the physical. This will help to mitigate in cases where there excess polybags.

value:
·       Utto variance is a result of the introduction of new tins. The variance will be minimal over time

Yeast is above the limit of 0.125kg. I will monitor shift-wise to ensure yeast is well utilized.

·       More utto was used by Tin Greaser as some the tins are new.

I will monitor to ensure Yeast is utilized as required.

·       In the prior Audit During this

 period,daily

utto consumption/

bag was 0.125kg/bag

·       Yeast consumption reported over the same period was 107.5kg and this was within the allowed set standard consumption from production of 860bags.
Previous
Physical stock is compared with SAP stem.
Stock procedures was adhererd to.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure there no or minimal variance between the physical stock and book stock.

attributes.title: Bread Weight Check
attributes.description:
·       We conducted Bread weight spot checks on 1 March 2025 on packed bread ready to be dispatched to the market to determine whether the bread dispatched to the market meets the required weight standards.

·       From the selected sample, bread Overweight were noted in

     Overweight Products:

·       200g WB : 35% overweight

·       400g White : 21% overweight
attributes.recommendation: Strict adherence to set standard dough weights in order to attain standard weight bread.
attributes.effect: Overweight bread lowers yield targets hence revenue targets not realized.
attributes.remediation_plan:
To ensure all bread varieties comply with the required weight standards, reducing instances of underweight and overweight products, thereby maintaining regulatory compliance and customer satisfaction by

  • Enforce strict weight control measures at the production level.

  • Conduct regular calibration of weighing machines.

  • Increase spot checks on packed bread before dispatch.

value: Concentration is on underweight bread but improve controls on overweight breads.
The production team should follow the required procedure to minimize cases of Overweight breads.

·       In the prior audit, we noted the following   Under weights bread;

ü  400g W

0%.

ü  200g W -12%

·       Overweight bread

Were as follows:

ü  4
Previous
Physically weight bread guided by the set weight ranges
Bread weights set standards should be adhered to.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure bread is of correct weight as per set standards.

attributes.title: Bread Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings

·       We reviewed the damages for the period 1 to 28 February 2025 on 4 March 2025 to determine if there were instances of excess damages beyond the set standard limits of 0.25% of total production for production damages and 0.2% of total sales for market damages.

·       It was observed that  production-related damages were within the established limits, but The market damage percentage exceeded the KPI target by 0.105%, indicating a slight increase in losses related to goods reaching the market in an unsellable condition as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation: To adhere to the set quality control parameters within the production process to minimize production damages.
attributes.effect:
·       Production damages are within the set limit meaning the revenue target were realized.

Market Damages (slightly higher than target): The extra 366.48 loaves of translates into a cost implication of KES 19,423.44 in terms of lost sales.

value: This has been sorted, and the market returns have reduced.
The damage resulted from the high number of breads returned by vendors due to expiring before the stated date. This led to a reduction in production to minimize the high volume of market returns
·       In the prior Audit During this period, Production damage was 0.19 and Market Damage was 0.193.
Previous
The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within the set limits.
The production and market damages were within the set limit.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring controlled bread damages within the allowed limits.

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·       An analysis of mixing charts and summaries was done for a period of 28 days from 1 February to 28 February 2025 on 3 March 2025 to determine if the raw materials usage were as per the set BOM and if the set production standards were achieved.

·       An analysis was also performed to verify if there were any significant variances between the mixing chart summary and the SAP system.

·       The variances noted are as shown in the mixing chart below Appendix2

·       The table below shows a summarized findings of the mixing chart analysis.
attributes.recommendation:
·       The branch should work towards achieving the set production target.

·       Work with management to establish a more balanced target that reflects both current capacity and achievable growth in output.
attributes.effect:
·       Production target was below the set target. This represents a shortfall of 15.75 bags per day, and this indicated that the branch’s production was not utilized fully by 21%, which could imply less sales.

The Average yield was within the set target, however even with good yield, less production leads to a gap in overall output.

value: We will work toward achieving the set production target.

·       The production target is achievable; however, cutting down production led to not meeting the set target.

The variance in the mixing chart was due to disassemble done on 21st .
·       No previous Findings.
Previous
omparison of manual mixing charts and the SAP mixing charts was done from 1st to 28th February 2025 to find out Manual Mixing Chart was matching with SAP System.
Set Yield, Consumption was observed apart from set production target which was not achieved due to low sales orders.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure the set Yield, Consumption of Raw Materials and Production Bags is achieved.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency Analysis
attributes.description:
·       Production efficiency was calculated for a period of 28 days from 1February 2025 to 28 February 2024 on 4 March 2025. The aim was to determine if the production workers hired were achieving the set production efficiency of 5 bags.

·       It was noted that the production efficiency was 4.60 bags per production worker, which was below the set efficiency level.

A summary of the analysis is shown below;
attributes.recommendation: Reevaluate Workforce Utilization. Consider whether 354 workers are required for the given workload.
attributes.effect:
The company hired 354 workers but only needed 326 workers (at the target efficiency). The 28 extra workers were not necessary to meet the actual production. This translates to cost implication of KES 30,428.80.

Underproduction also leads to potential lost sales, impacting revenue and profitability.

value: Set production bags per worker was not met due to cutting down production, however we are working towards achieving the set target.
Cutting down production affected production efficiency.
In previous audit, the production Efficiency was 4.91 Per worker
Previous

This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs. Standard production efficiency is 5bags per staff.
Production efficiency was not attained. It was slightly below the set target. (4.6) per production worker
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring set production efficiency is adhered to.

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description:
·       Packing Efficiency was computed for period of 28 days from 1 February 2025 to 28 February 2025 on 4 March 2025 to determine whether the set company standard of 97 crates per slicer was being achieved.

·       The findings revealed that the average slicing efficiency for the period was 94.89 crates per slicer.

·       The table below illustrates the findings;-
attributes.recommendation: The branch manager should conduct a review of whether the 5 additional slicers were truly necessary to achieve 98% efficiency.
attributes.effect: The company spent an additional cost of KES 4,560 on 5 extra slicers.

value: I will ensure that slicers are hired according to the production shift requirements.
I will follow up with the slicers to ensure they achieve the set target of 97 crates per slicer.
In the previous audit, it was noted that the packing efficiency was 102.5 Per Packer.
Previous

Get the total production for the 3shift of previous day, 1shift, and 2shift of the current day, then less FOC, Less Production damages, less oven damages and less deductions (short or bread)

=Loaves to be packed
The slicing efficiency was close to the target.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure set efficiency of 97 crates per slicer is achieved.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check
attributes.description:
Findings:

·       A spot check was conducted in the mini shop on 3 & 4 March 2025 to assess whether the operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.

·       The physical quantities of various varieties were compared to the DDS balance, and the variance was calculated to identify any discrepancies.

·       It was noted that there were no variances between the physical quantities and the DDS balances for all the minishops i.e. Shanzu, Mtwapa, and Kanamai Minishops.
attributes.recommendation: The company continues to follow strong reconciliation procedures between the physical counts and the DDS balances, to ensure ongoing accuracy and to catch any potential discrepancies early on.
attributes.effect: The consistency between physical stock and DDS data implies that the internal controls governing the stock counting and recording processes are effective.

value: Controls are effective and will be maintained.
Strong controls will be maintained.
No previous findings
Previous

Stock to be done on the 1day of audit preferably before stock take.
 Loadings in the manager ‘s and guard’s book are compared with the STN used for loading the mini shop.
The controls were effective at Mtondia, Matsangoni and Mtondia Minishops.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure the DDS balance reconciles with physical stock.

attributes.title: Vehicle Mileage & Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
The purpose of this audit was to assess and analyze the fuel consumption of the branch sales vehicle for the period from 1 February to 28 February 2025. The primary objectives were to evaluate compliance with fuel efficiency standards, identify any areas of inefficiency, and recommend strategies for reducing fuel consumption and associated costs.

On 4th March 2025, it was noted that fuel consumption at the branch was within the set standards
attributes.recommendation: All vehicles should be fueled at the end of every month.
attributes.effect: Higher actual consumption rate than the set standard rate implies that the controls are strong.

value:
KBV 276J was not fueled on 17th and 18th and this affected the consumption rate (Higher Saving).

KDH 926N was not fueled at the end of January. This affected fuel consumption. (Higher Saving)
I will ensure every end month the vehicles are fuelled in order to get the correct fuel consumption rate.
·       No previous findings.
Previous
The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file.
Effective fuel consumption
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring that all sales vans fuel consumption is as per set standards.

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Fuel consumption tests were carried out on 1 March 2025 to determine if set consumption standards for generator was adhered to. Standard fuel consumption for the branch generator was 16.89L/Hr.

·       The Generator is consuming more fuel than the set standard, with a difference of (0.54) liters per hour.

·       It was also noted that the Agana system is not reliable and provides inaccurate information.

·       Summarized generator fuel consumption from February 1 to 24February, 2025 is analyzed on the below table.
attributes.recommendation:
It's essential to track he generator's average fuel consumption regularly and compare it with standard fuel consumption of the generator.

The Agana system should be examined or tested to ensure it works consistently and accurately.
attributes.effect: The generator consumption was lightly above the set standards. This implies the generator is not saving.

value: The consumption rate is close to the set standard.
The consumption is okay.
In the previous Audit, Consumption rate was 17.11L/HR.
Previous
The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption was economical.
The consumption rate was slightly above the set standard rate.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring generator fuel is fully utilized.

attributes.title: Debtors Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       An analysis of the debt balance as at 4 March 2025 was performed to identify any occurrences of bad debts or unresolved balances by route.

·       During the audit, it was noted that there were no balances.
attributes.recommendation: ·       Continue adhering to company policies.
attributes.effect: No balance implies the controls are effective.

value: Noted.
I will maintain proper controls.
No previous findings.
Previous

Any customer with route balance should be an audit query and also find out if the customer has  a security deposit and how much. If the security deposit is more than the outstanding debt, then it is not a risk to the company
No outstanding route balances. Controls are effective.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure there no outstanding route balances.

attributes.title: Cash Verification
attributes.description:
Finding;

·       Verification of cash held at the cash office was done on 1 March 2025, to confirm if the cash held by the cashier tallied with book records and whether the set cash operation standards were adhered to.

·       During the cash count, the variance noted was minimal  as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation: ·Proper reconciliation procedures must be maintained to ensure accuracy and integrity of the cash records.
attributes.effect: · The cash balance seems to be accurate, with only a small discrepancy of KES +0.79.

value: Minimal variance indicates strong controls.
·       Cash control will be maintained.
·       In the prior audit report, we noted a minimal variance of +1.12.
Previous
Physical cash was verified on 01/03/2025 to check whether cash counted matched that on SAP balances.
Minimal cash variance suggest effective controls were put in place.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring Cash Controls are strong.
